channel.title: DubStep - Taking over the world :L
channel.description:
Anyone I see on forums are talking about dubset, even on Runescape they talk about dubstep at first I thought it was some artist... But not this is the music culture of the future and I dont approve of it.
:p

item.title: DubStep - Taking over the world :L
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

vexx1345:

I just don’t like dubstep. basically it sucks.

Depends who you’re listening too, some of it is really shocking, but there’s such a variety of entirely different sounds all classified as one genre, it’s hard to say the genre as a whole sucks.

item.title: DubStep - Taking over the world :L
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:58, topic:413844”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=515812.msg3742194#msg3742194 date=1315446087]

dubstep is shit, hence why no one can explain one thing they like about dubstep.

Dubstep is amazing. Everybody loves dubstep except the emos that listen to metal and shit.
[/quote]
I listen to dubstep and metal, and no, I’m not emo.[/quote]
A lot of the rock and metal listeners turned to dubstep because it can be quite similar in some respects, take skrillex’s collaboration with Korn for example.

And if you guys want dancy based dubstep then listen to some of Feed Me’s stuff, that’s certainly ‘danceable’.

Read full topic

item.title: DubStep - Taking over the world :L
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Not_a_bot, post:72, topic:413844”]Dubstep was fine up until everyone decided it was the new fad and only started liking it just for that reason alone.

EDIT: Skrillex sucks. he uses the same generic material for nearly all his shit. Some of the better ones are not well known, and usually are considered “underground” artists.[/quote]Skrillex isn’t main stream at all, he just had really good shit… literally… He just came out with his first EP like… last year and everyone liked it because of the quality. And if you’re complaining about his constant use of the same synths and basslines, take a look at your other artists. Most of them recycle their synths and basslines as well.

[quote=“Frell, post:74, topic:413844”]The reaper not all dubstep has rhythm. I noticed YOURS does though and thats why I like it.[/quote]Yeah, if you’re talking about excision and artists like that then yeah I can see what you mean. Dubstep started off though as jamacan dub, shit no one listens to around here. And most of that was instrumentals with awkward kicklines and hats are always swinging or somewhat offbeat. So most of the artists that actually like keeping dubstep at its main roots will hold true to those weird drum-lines.

Read full topic

item.title: DubStep - Taking over the world :L
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

The reaper not all dubstep has rhythm. I noticed YOURS does though and thats why I like it.

Read full topic

item.title: DubStep - Taking over the world :L
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

  • Most creative genre.

  • Covers natural - electronic

  • @Frell, rhythm is more than apparent, in fact half the genre depends on rhythm

  • Vocals are available as well

  • Mixing dubstep is more difficult than mixing any other genre when producing. EQ levels will make any rap producer cry.

  • Flexibility is extraordinary.

Dubstep isn’t taking over the world… It’s just another new genre… College hipsters buttfuck the world with new music everyday and no one cries about that, dubstep is just the furthest thing from normal that’s been noticed

Read full topic

item.title: DubStep - Taking over the world :L
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

The dubstep genre is too over exaggerated. Everyone claims that it’s the best, though, I’ve heard better. Don’t get me wrong, I am a minor fan of dubstep, I would just listen to many, many things over it. Though Imsuperman05 is wrong, it’s not good dancing music. If you want to dance to anything of the sort, I would recommend a nice hardstyle techno song.

I listen to many genres, from rap to rock, dubstep to metal. My most preferred genre would be metal, though not the metal to where, like Frell said, “BLAAAAAHHHH CUT MYSELF,” I listen to metal such as Black Veil Brides, as anytime the lead singer [Andy Sixx] screams, it’s never for very long. He sings with meaning to his songs, that’s why I like Eminem. If I’m looking for a good beat, I usually listen to techno/instrumental rap.

Read full topic
